channel.title: Damn Door
channel.description:
Been working on a server for a few weeks and I got myself into consolidating every skill into one area. I'm a beginner but this is coming out very nicely :)
My only problem is I can't delete a door, there's a perfect building I'm trying to turn into a bank/skiller outfits zone thing ahah
[code]----- Deleting Objects ----- To Delete Global Objects Go Into Client.java, Hit Ctrl + F And Search For This Code:
Code: [Select] Deleteobjects() {
Then Scroll Down And You Should See Something Like This Code:
Code:
Code: [Select] deletethatobject(2785, 3175); //plant
This Is Much Simpler Than Adding Objects As All You Need To Do Is Enter The X & Y Coordinates Of The Object You Want To Delete. NOTE: If You Delete An Object You Will Not Be Able To Place A New Object In The Position Of The Deleted Object, If You Want To Place A New Object Simply Add That Object As It Will Automatically Change The Object Thats In Its Place.[/code]
I got this off a tutorial, This is the easiest part of everything I've done it feels but somehow It will not go the Fak away. Any suggestions would be nice. I'm not giving up:P
EDIT this is a PI 317

item.title: Damn Door
item.dc:creator: @owwch_u_died owwch u died
item.description:
@owwch_u_died wrote:

Where tho codes are… make a new object id “6951” should work like a charm.

and obviously put your coords for where your door is.

Let me know if it works.

item.description:
@Andys_Awesome wrote:

[quote=“owwch u died, post:13, topic:456920”]You can add me on skype maybe, i’ll help… more.

If you cant find where to delete an object or remove one… i have no idea wat to do for you.
PI fails r0fl.[/quote]

Thanks for the help mate =) I know i’m close…

//objectId X Y H Face objectType object = 1530 3234 3156 0 -1 -1 object = 409 3091 3506 0 -1 10 [ENDOFOBJECTLIST]

object 1530 is my door. this is in Object.cfg

I made a guide on this in tutorials search deleting doors delta (snipit section)

I’m on a PI my door is "objectId: 1530 objectX: 3234 objectY: 3156
I can’t find anywhere to remove this . I’ll swing by your guide but if you get a second help your boy out :):)

Edit: … go back where you came from lol…

has anyone worked with a PI? if you could help me find the right .java then ill pull the rest out of my ass I promise lol

Found this in my objecthandler.java
no luck with deleteobject

public void removeObject(Objects object) { globalObjects.remove(object);
^ was to remove an object from a list there is also

public void addObject(Objects object) { globalObjects.add(object);
Also found a doors.cfg

Its a full list of doors but mines not on it. could any of this help?

item.title: Damn Door
item.dc:creator: @Andys_Awesome Andys Awesome
item.description:
@Andys_Awesome wrote:

[quote=“owwch u died, post:7, topic:456920”]Makeobject or makeglobal isnt in there…? hmm.

hold on… add this under deleteobject in client.java after the last “}”

public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
if(p != null){
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”)){
if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
if(person.heightLevel >= 0){
person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);}}}}}}
public void NewObjects() { //
//makeGlobalObject([color=red]x coord[/color], [color=red]y coord[/color], 6951, -1, 0);
}[/quote]

Nah, The word “delete” isn’t even in my client.java PI and Delta must be quite different. The other dude had no idea what he was saying lol

Read full topic

hold on… add this under deleteobject in client.java after the last “}”

public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
if(p != null){
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”)){
if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
if(person.heightLevel >= 0){
person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);}}}}}}
public void NewObjects() { //
//makeGlobalObject([color=red]x coord[/color], [color=red]y coord[/color], 6951, -1, 0);
}

item.title: Damn Door
item.dc:creator: @RsMakerWoad RsMakerWoad
item.description:
@RsMakerWoad wrote:

[quote=“owwch u died, post:4, topic:456920”]I dont know too much about Pi’s but… i have a 317 delta and wat i did was…

Go into client.java and find “MakeglobalObject” Or “makeobject”

You’ll see a long list of items.

go to the bottom and add your own code.

Something like this: makeGlobalObject(X coord, Y coord, 6951, -1, 0)

item object 6951 = nothing, which will take the door out.[/quote]

Thats how you do it, on Pi Too

Read full topic

go to the bottom and add your own code.

item object 6951 = nothing, which will take the door out.

Been working on a server for a few weeks and I got myself into consolidating every skill into one area. I’m a beginner but this is coming out very nicely

My only problem is I can’t delete a door, there’s a perfect building I’m trying to turn into a bank/skiller outfits zone thing ahah

[code]----- Deleting Objects -----
To Delete Global Objects Go Into Client.java, Hit Ctrl + F And Search For This
Code:

Code: [Select]
Deleteobjects() {

Then Scroll Down And You Should See Something Like This
Code:

Code:

Code: [Select]
deletethatobject(2785, 3175); //plant

This Is Much Simpler Than Adding Objects As All You Need To Do Is Enter The X & Y Coordinates Of The Object You Want To Delete. NOTE: If You Delete An Object You Will Not Be Able To Place A New Object In The Position Of The Deleted Object, If You Want To Place A New Object Simply Add That Object As It Will Automatically Change The Object Thats In Its Place.[/code]

I got this off a tutorial, This is the easiest part of everything I’ve done it feels but somehow It will not go the Fak away. Any suggestions would be nice. I’m not giving up:P
